javadoc:
Top level object that manages each step of the merge/resolve conflicts
 process.

methods.name: getProgram
methods.comment: Returns one of the four programs involved in the merge as indicated by the version.

params.name: version
params.comment: the program version to return. (LATEST, MY, ORIGINAL, or RESULT).

return.comment: the indicated program version or null if a valid version isn't specified.

methods.name: showDefaultMergePanel
methods.comment:
Show the default merge panel. The default merge panel now shows the status of each phase
 of the merge and also the progress in the current phase.

params.name: description
params.comment: description of current merge process near the top of the merge tool.

methods.javadoc:
Show the component that is used to resolve conflicts. This method
 is called by the MergeResolvers when user input is required. If the
 component is not null, this method blocks until the user either 
 cancels the merge process or resolves a conflict. If comp is null,
 then the default component is displayed, and the method does not
 wait for user input.
@param comp component to show; if component is null, show the 
 default component and do not block
@param componentID id or name for the component
methods.name: showComponent
methods.comment:
Show the component that is used to resolve conflicts. This method
 is called by the MergeResolvers when user input is required. If the
 component is not null, this method blocks until the user either 
 cancels the merge process or resolves a conflict. If comp is null,
 then the default component is displayed, and the method does not
 wait for user input.

params.name: comp
params.comment:
component to show; if component is null, show the 
 default component and do not block

params.name: componentID
params.comment: id or name for the component

methods.name: showListingMergePanel
refreshListingMergePanel
methods.comment:
Show the listing merge panel with each listing positioned to the indicated address.
 A null can be passed for any address to indicate that listing should be empty.

params.name: resultAddress
params.comment: the address for positioning the Result program's listing.

params.name: latestAddress
params.comment: the address for positioning the Latest program's listing.

params.name: myAddress
params.comment: the address for positioning the My program's listing.

params.name: originalAddress
params.comment: the address for positioning the Original program's listing.

methods.name: showListingMergePanel
methods.comment:
Show the listing merge panel with each listing positioned to the indicated address.
 A null can be passed for any address to indicate that listing should be empty.

params.name: resultAddress
params.comment: the address for positioning the Result program's listing.

params.name: latestAddress
params.comment: the address for positioning the Latest program's listing.

params.name: myAddress
params.comment: the address for positioning the My program's listing.

params.name: originalAddress
params.comment: the address for positioning the Original program's listing.

methods.javadoc: Remove the listing merge panel from the merge manager.
methods.name: removeListingMergePanel
methods.comment: Remove the listing merge panel from the merge manager.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the listing merge panel. This is the panel containing the four
 listing windows: result, latest, my, and original. The four listings are
 the center component of JPanel with a BorderLayout.
methods.name: getListingMergePanel
methods.comment:
Returns the listing merge panel. This is the panel containing the four
 listing windows: result, latest, my, and original. The four listings are
 the center component of JPanel with a BorderLayout.

methods.javadoc:
Determines if the modal merge tool is currently displayed on the screen.
@return true if the merge tool is displayed.
methods.name: isMergeToolVisible
methods.comment: Determines if the modal merge tool is currently displayed on the screen.

return.comment: true if the merge tool is displayed.

methods.javadoc:
Determines if the four program Listing merge panel is currently displayed in the merge tool.
@return true if the Listing merge panel is displayed.
methods.name: isShowingListingMergePanel
methods.comment: Determines if the four program Listing merge panel is currently displayed in the merge tool.

return.comment: true if the Listing merge panel is displayed.

name: ProgramMultiUserMergeManager
comment:
Top level object that manages each step of the merge/resolve conflicts
 process.
